info.description:
This page shows how to use HTTP requests to access the Genome Nexus API. There are more high level clients available in Python, R, JavaScript, TypeScript and various other languages as well as a command line client to annotate MAF and VCF. See https://docs.genomenexus.org/api.

Aside from programmatic clients there are web based tools to annotate variants, see https://docs.genomenexus.org/tools.

 We currently only provide long-term support for the '/annotation' endpoint. The other endpoints might change.
info.title: Genome Nexus API

post.summary: Retrieves VEP annotation summary for the provided list of variants

parameters.name: isoformOverrideSource
parameters.description: Isoform override source. For example uniprot

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Indicates whether to return summary for all transcripts or only for canonical transcript

get.summary: Retrieves VEP annotation summary for the provided variant

parameters.name: isoformOverrideSource
parameters.description: Isoform override source. For example uniprot

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description: Indicates whether to return summary for all transcripts or only for canonical transcript

post.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for the provided list of genomic locations

get.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for a specific genomic location

post.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for the provided list of variants

get.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for a specific variant

post.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for the provided list of transcript id, protein location and mutation type

parameters.name: proteinLocations
parameters.description: List of transcript id, protein start location, protein end location, mutation type.  The mutation types are limited to 'Missense_Mutation', 'In_Frame_Ins', 'In_Frame_Del', 'Splice_Site', and 'Splice_Region'

post.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for the provided list of transcript ID

parameters.name: transcriptIds
parameters.description: List of transcript Id. For example ["ENST00000288602","ENST00000256078"]

get.summary: Retrieves hotspot annotations for the provided transcript ID

parameters.name: transcriptId
parameters.description: A Transcript Id. For example ENST00000288602

post.summary: Gets the isoform override information for the specified source and the list of transcript ids

parameters.name: transcriptIds
parameters.description: List of transcript ids. For example ["ENST00000361125","ENST00000443649"].

get.summary: Gets a list of available isoform override data sources
Gets the isoform override information for the specified source
Gets the isoform override information for the specified source and transcript id

post.summary: Retrieves mutation assessor information for the provided list of variants

get.summary: Retrieves mutation assessor information for the provided list of variants

post.summary: Retrieves myvariant information for the provided list of variants

get.summary: Retrieves myvariant information for the provided list of variants
Retrieves SignalDB mutations by Hugo Gene Symbol

post.summary: Retrieves SignalDB mutations by Mutation Filter

parameters.name: mutationFilter
parameters.description: List of Hugo Gene Symbols. For example ["TP53", "PIK3CA", "BRCA1"]

get.summary: Perform lookups of Ensembl identifiers and retrieve their external references in other databases

parameters.name: accession
parameters.description: Ensembl gene accession. For example ENSG00000169083

cosmicCount.description: Number of mutations in COSMIC for this protein

msaGaps.description: Portion of gaps in variant position in multiple sequence alignment

msaHeight.description: Number of diverse sequences in multiple sequence alignment (identical or highly similar sequences filtered out)

refseqPosition.description: Variant position in Refseq protein, can be different from the one in Uniprot

refseqResidue.description: Reference residue in Refseq protein, can be different from the one in Uniprot

snpCount.description: Number of SNPs in dbSNP for this protein

uniprotPosition.description: Variant position in Uniprot protein, can be different from the one in Refseq

uniprotResidue.description: Reference residue in Uniprot protein, can be different from the one in Refseq

qcPassCountsByTumorType.description: QC Pass Counts by Tumor Type

hugoSymbols.description: List of Hugo Symbols. For example ["TP53", "PIK3CA", "BRCA1"]

transcriptConsequenceSummary.description: Most impactful transcript consequence of canonical transcript or if non-existent any transcript

transcriptConsequences.description: (Deprecated) Transcript consequence summaries (list of one when using annotation/, multiple when using annotation/summary/
